creator: paulfranz@email.msn.com
text:
I currently have to download the Windows version of the source code to get the 
apr-iconv stuff which is required for rotatelogs to work.

creator: paulfranz@email.msn.com
text: Yup. I downloaded the tar.gz file from 2 different mirrors and neither had it.
Yes, but why do you think, it's necessary to build rotatelogs?
creator: nd@perlig.de
paulfranz@email.msn.com
text:
Well, unfortunately I can not test the theory since currently we have the 
libiconv.so.2 file in the /usr/lib directory. And we can not delete it due to 
other processes on the server. Also, if I we copy the binaries to another box 
(where they are to be installed) without the libiconv.so.2 rotatelogs will not 
run. Also the ldd output for rotatelogs looks like the following:

[user@server bin]$ ldd rotatelogs
        libaprutil-0.so.0 =>     ../lib/libaprutil-0.so.0
        libexpat.so.0 =>         ../lib/libexpat.so.0
        libiconv.so.2 =>         /usr/lib/libiconv.so.2  - Permission denied
        libapr-0.so.0 =>         ../lib/libapr-0.so.0
        librt.so.1 =>    /usr/lib/librt.so.1
        libm.so.1 =>     /usr/lib/libm.so.1
        libsocket.so.1 =>        /usr/lib/libsocket.so.1
        libnsl.so.1 =>   /usr/lib/libnsl.so.1
        libresolv.so.2 =>        /usr/lib/libresolv.so.2
        libpthread.so.1 =>       /usr/lib/libpthread.so.1
        libdl.so.1 =>    /usr/lib/libdl.so.1
        libc.so.1 =>     /usr/lib/libc.so.1
        libaio.so.1 =>   /usr/lib/libaio.so.1
        libmp.so.2 =>    /usr/lib/libmp.so.2
        libthread.so.1 =>        /usr/lib/libthread.so.1
        /usr/platform/SUNW,Sun-Fire-280R/lib/libc_psr.so.1

Which leads me to believe that it is required to build since it is linked in.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Ah, no. APR or APR-UTIL are linked against iconv, which is detected at compile
time and in this case is not the apr-iconv lib. 

Just install the same libiconv.so on the other box.
